bibl.title: Haronnophris and Chaonnophris. Two Indigenous Pharaohs in Ptolemaic Egypt (205-186 B.C.).
bibl.note: I. The revolt; - The first period: the reign of Haronnophris; - The second period: the reign of Chaonnophris; - The third period: the last years of Chaonnophris. - II. The texts. - III. Miscellaneous subjects: The names of the two indigenous Pharaohs; - The dates of the reigns of Haronnophris and Chaonnophris; - Notaries writing in the name of the priests of Amonrasonter; - The eponymous priests of "year 7" and the first Greek offensive; - Elephantine; - References to "year 16".

bibl.title: Hundred-Gated Thebes. Acts of a Colloquium on Thebes and the Theban Area in the Graeco-Roman Period

bibl.seg: PESTMAN P.W., Haronnophris and Chaonnophris. Two Indigenous Pharaohs in Ptolemaic Egypt (205-186 B.C.).
S.P. VLEEMING (Ed.), Hundred-Gated Thebes. Acts of a Colloquium on Thebes and the Theban Area in the Graeco-Roman Period = Papyrologica Lugduno-Batava. XXVII (Leiden, 1995) pp. 101-137, tabl.

I. The revolt; - The first period: the reign of Haronnophris; - The second period: the reign of Chaonnophris; - The third period: the last years of Chaonnophris. - II. The texts. - III. Miscellaneous subjects: The names of the two indigenous Pharaohs; - The dates of the reigns of Haronnophris and Chaonnophris; - Notaries writing in the name of the priests of Amonrasonter; - The eponymous priests of "year 7" and the first Greek offensive; - Elephantine; - References to "year 16".
